newsitem.title: JAPAN: Marubeni eyes China zinc-coated steel deal.
newsitem.headline: Marubeni eyes China zinc-coated steel deal.

text.p: Marubeni Corp has reached a basic agreement on the details of a joint venture to build a 50,000 tonne-per-year zinc-coated steel sheet plant in Kunming, in China's Yunnan province, a spokesman said on Monday.
He said the trade house had not yet made a final decision on whether to proceed with the project, although one was expected soon.

Confirming a report in a Japanese trade publication on Monday, he said Marubeni planned to take a 55 percent stake in the project with the remainder held by Yunnan Metallurgical Group. The venture is to be capitalised at $10 million.
The new company is scheduled to be set up next month, with operations likely to begin in the autumn of 1997.
The plant is expected to supply zinc-coated steel sheet to the machinery and construction sectors. -- Tokyo Commodities Desk (81-3 3432 6179)
